Package game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game
  • public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements all of the game logic. It is meant to be separate from the method in which the game is presented to the user.
    See Also:
    GameUi

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Game.Button
      Enumerates the buttons available to the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(TileSet tileSet)
        Constructs a new instance of the game.
        Parameters:
        tileSet - The game's tile data.

    • Method Detail

      • addTileMap

        public void addTileMap​(TileMap tileMap)
        Adds a tile map to the game.
        Parameters:
        tileMap - The tile map to add to the game.

      • advance

        public void advance​(int milliseconds)
        This function is called to move the game forward in time by a certain number of milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - The number of milliseconds in which to move the game forward.

      • axisUpdate

        public void axisUpdate​(int controller,
                       double x,
                       double y)
        This function is called when the user moves the analog stick. For keyboard controls, this means either the arrow keys or the WASD keys.
        Parameters:
        controller - The ID of the controller that is being updated. This is only relevant for multiplayer, in which case player 2 would have a value for one, player 3 would have a value of two, and so one. For single player, the value will always be zero.
        x - The new X value that the axis was updated to. For keyboard controls, this will either be -1, 0, or 1. For analog controls, this will be anywhere within the range of -1 and 1.
        y - The new Y value that the axis was updated to. For keyboard controls, this will either be -1, 0, or 1. For analog controls, this will be anywhere within the range of -1 and 1.

      • buttonUpdate

        public void buttonUpdate​(int controller,
                         Game.Button button,
                         boolean state)
        This function is called when the user either lets go or presses a button.
        Parameters:
        controller - The ID of the controller whose button was pressed or released.
        button - The button that was pressed or release.
        state - The new state of the button. A value of true means that the button was pressed, a value of false means the button was released.

      • getTitle

        public java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gets the title of the game. This is eventually used to be displayed on the title of the window.
        Returns:
        The name of the game, as a title.

      • getCurrentMap

        public TileMap getCurrentMap()
        Accesses the current map being played.

      • getPlayerPosition

        public game.Vector getPlayerPosition()
        Gets the position of the player. The game renderer uses this information to render the active part of the current map.
        Returns:
        The player position, in terms of tile coordinates.

      • getMapFileNames

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getMapFileNames()
        This function gets a list of file names of all the maps for the game. This is used by the calling environment (desktop or browser) to determine which files to open as maps.
        Returns:
        An alphabetical list of map file names.
